Message.Title: Will the real Obama please stand up. Talk about flip floppers
Message.Msg: The fact that we are here today to debate raising America 's debt limit is a sign of leadership failure. It is a sign that the US Government cannot pay its own bills. It is a sign that we now depend on ongoing financial assistance from foreign countries to finance our Government's reckless fiscal policies. Increasing America 's debt weakens us domestically and internationally. Leadership means that, "the buck stops here.' Instead, Washington is shifting the burden of bad choices today onto the backs of our children and grandchildren. America has a debt problem and a failure of leadership. Americans deserve better. Senator Barack H. Obama, March 2006 ."Now let me be clear -- I suffer no illusions about Saddam Hussein. He is a brutal m... "Now let me be clear -- I suffer no illusions about Saddam Hussein. He is a brutal man. A ruthless man. A man who butchers his own people to secure his own power. He has repeatedly defied UN resolutions, thwarted UN inspection teams, developed chemical and biological weapons, and coveted nuclear capacity. He's a bad guy. The world, and the Iraqi people, would be better off without him." State Senator Barack Obama (Democrat, Illinois) Speech at Federal Plaza, Chicago, Illinois October 2, 2002

Topic.Title: Kill Off The Windows RT Tablet - Nobody Is Buying Anway

Message.Msg: No, it's not the instruction set, it's the fact that software development isn't instantaneous and can't be done without personnel and resources. Once all the infrastructure gets ported to the ARM architecture there could very well be a cohesive set of ARM and Intel based apps. It may take a couple years though. In the mean time there is less and less motivation to do it as the relevance of the ecosystem "Waynes" -- Party on, Garth!
